name: Vegan Gluten free Banana Muffins
description: Vegan Gluten free Banana Muffins . Easy Breakfast Muffins. Almond flour, Oat flour, starch and 2 bananas with large Chocolate chunks. Glutenfree Recipe soyfree. Makes 7 to 8 regular size muffins.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp vinegar (apple cider vinegar or white vinegar or use lemon juice)
1/3-1/2 cup sugar (I usually use a 1/3 cup with very ripe bananas for a lightly sweet muffin)
1/2 cup certified gf oat flour or use other gluten-free flours like sorghum or rice flour
1/4 cup starch (I use 2 tbsp tapioca starch and 2 tbsp potato starch.)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mash the bananas really well. Add the rest of the ingredients under wet and mix until the sugar is well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mash the bananas really well. Add the rest of the ingredients under wet and mix until the sugar is well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients except the chocolate chunks, until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients except the chocolate chunks, until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the dry into the wet until well combined. Fold in the chocolate chunks.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the dry into the wet until well combined. Fold in the chocolate chunks.

recipeInstructions.text: Drop the batter into lined muffin pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Drop the batter into lined muffin pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 20 minutes, then reduce temperature to 375 and continue to bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Check at the 23 or 24 minute mark. Toothpick from the center should come out almost clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 20 minutes, then reduce temperature to 375 and continue to bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Check at the 23 or 24 minute mark. Toothpick from the center should come out almost clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the muffins rest for 2 minutes then remove from the muffin pan and let them cool on a cooling rack lightly covered by a kitchen towel. Store on the counter for the day and refrigerate for upto 5 days
recipeInstructions.name: Let the muffins rest for 2 minutes then remove from the muffin pan and let them cool on a cooling rack lightly covered by a kitchen towel. Store on the counter for the day and refrigerate for upto 5 days
